meanings.definition: To date with a date earlier than the actual date.
meanings.sent1: I will backdate the letter to show it was sent last week.
meanings.sent2: It is not allowed to backdate official documents.
meanings.sent3: The professor joked that he would backdate the assignment to before the due date.
meanings.sent4: Her memory seemed to backdate to a time long before she was born.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph was backdated by the faded colors and worn edges.

meanings.definition: To make effective from a date in the past.
meanings.sent1: The contract was backdated to ensure it complied with regulations.
meanings.sent2: Backdating the policy change helped avoid confusion.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could backdate the disappearance of the coin.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to forgive him seemed to backdate their relationship to a happier time.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the discovery was backdated to a momentous event in history.

meanings.definition: To assign a date to a document earlier than the actual date.
meanings.sent1: The secretary was asked to backdate the contract for legal reasons.
meanings.sent2: It is unethical to backdate financial records.
meanings.sent3: The detective suspected foul play when he found a backdated entry in the logbook.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work seemed to backdate the viewer to a different era.
meanings.sent5: The diary entry was backdated to capture the true emotions of the moment.
